source.title: Set up cells and induce expression

source.description:
When the OD600 has reached 0.7-0.9, change the temperature setting of the Infors incubator to
and incubate the cells for at least another hour, all the while shaking at

source.description:
When the flasks have cooled down to
or lower, induce PPM1H expression by supplementing the medium with

source.body: This is achieved by adding of a IPTG stock solution to each litre.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Decant the content of the
conical flasks into
Beckman centrifuge pots, close the pots with their screw-cap lids and sediment the cells by centrifugation for
at
at
using a Beckman J6 centrifuge with the 6 x
rotor (4.2).

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description: Collect and open the pots and carefully decant the spent supernatant medium back into the flasks.

source.body: The flasks can now be sent for cleaning and autoclaving. The cell sediment in the pots is expected to have a volume of – .

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Add
of cold cell collection buffer to the sediment.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Transfer the
pots to the Infors incubator and set the temperature to
and the rotation to
.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Leave the pots for
, after which time the cell sediment should have completely resuspended.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Pool all suspensions into one of the pots using a
pipette and a good pipettor. If any of the sediments has not well resuspended, pipette up and down close to the bottom of the pots.

source.body: It is very useful at this stage to supplement the NaCl concentration to and add glycerol to 5% (by vol) final concentration. It is important to add the NaCl and glycerol after the resuspension step and not before as this interferes with the resuspension.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Once the NaCl and glycerol has been mixed in,
samples are aliquoted into
centrifuge vials and freeze them in liquid nitrogen for at least
.

source.title: Collection of cells and preparation of lysate

source.description:
Store the vials at
.

source.body: The freezing and subsequent thawing step breaks up the cells and improves yield. Vials can be stored at -20ºC for up to 4 weeks.

and then sonicate, using a probe sonicator (Cell disruptor). Settings: 6 – 8 pulses of
with

at
and
using a JA25.50 or a JA30.50 rotor in a Beckman Avanti centrifuge.

source.title: Preparation of cell lysate and pulldown of His-SUMO-PPM1H on Cobalt-resin

source.description:
Recover the supernatant by carefully decanting it into
conical centrifuge tubes. During the centrifugation step equilibrate
Cobalt-NTA-resin (
of a 50% slurry by vol, sufficient for a 3 L expression) by washing it three times with Milli Q water and once with cell collection buffer.

source.title: Removal of the His-SUMO-tag with His-SENP1 (415-644)

source.description:
For each
of eluted PPM1H, mix with
of His-SENP1.

source.body: For certain applications it may be desirable to remove the N-terminal 6His-SUMO-tag. This can be achieved by incubation of the eluted PPM1H with His-SENP1 (415-644).

source.title: Removal of the His-SUMO-tag with His-SENP1 (415-644)

source.description:
Transfer the proteins into a Snake Skin dialysis tube and dialyse
against
of dialysis buffer.

source.body: Dialysis removes 95% of the imidazole and also concentrates the PPM1H, due to the higher glycerol concentration in the dialysis buffer.

source.title: Removal of the His-SUMO-tag with His-SENP1 (415-644)

source.description:
Recover the protein the next day and remove the 6-His-SUMO-tag and the His-SENP1 by letting the proteins drip through a
bed of Cobalt-NTA-resin, equilibrate in dialysis buffer.

source.title: Removal of the His-SUMO-tag with His-SENP1 (415-644)

source.description:
Wash the bed with
of dialysis buffer and pool this wash with the flow through to maximise recovery.

source.title: Further purification by Size Exclusion Chromatography

source.description: In order to further improve the purity of the PPM1H and to separate the active dimer from less active tetramer, employ SEC using a SD200 column.

source.title: Further purification by Size Exclusion Chromatography

source.description:
Equilibrate a Superdex 200 XK 16/60 format in 3 column volumes of SEC buffer at a flowrate of
using an Äkta Purifier or an Äkta Pure.

source.title: Quality control

source.description:
Separate
of the protein on a Bis-Tris 4% - 12% SDS-polyacrylamide gel and stain with Instant Blue Figure 2.

description: A subset of small GTPases of the Rab family including Rab8A (Uniprot: P61006) and Rab10 (Uniprot: P61026) have been identified as substrates of the Leucine Rich Repeat Kinase 2 (LRRK2; Uniprot Q5S007)) (Steger et al., 2016). Recent work has revealed that Protein Phosphatase PPM1H (Uniprot Q9ULR3) is a cellular phosphatase that efficiently dephosphorylates LRRK2 phosphorylated Rab proteins (Berndsen et al., 2019). In order to study in detail the kinetics, mechanism and structure of PPM1H, it is necessary to produce milligrams of pure PPM1H protein. Here we describe in detail the method we use to produce milligram quantities PPM1H and several mutants.
